title: Mini Scandi crumble pies
time: Hands-on time 30 min, oven time 15 min, plus chilling
description: A crumbly mix of marzipan, pecans and oats top our vegan mince pies, before they’re topped with maple syrup and edible gold shimmer for extra Christmas pizazz.
ingredients: 500g block shortcrust pastry (see tip; we used Jus-Rol)
Edible gold glitter/shimmer (from Sainsbury’s or Waitrose; optional)
125g mincemeat (see tip; we used Meridian Organic Mince Pie Filling, which is vegan)
15g pecan halves, toasted in a dry frying pan and chopped
30g pecan halves, toasted in a dry frying pan and chopped
a 24-hole mini bun/muffin tray (we used KitchenCraft, from amazon.co.uk)

method.Step 1: Roll out the pastry on a lightly floured surface to 5mm thick. Use a cutter to stamp out 24 discs, re-rolling as necessary, then use the discs to line 24 holes of the tray. Chill for at least 30 minutes.

method.Step 2: Mix all the mincemeat ingredients together in a bowl. Cover until needed.

method.Step 3: Heat the oven to 190°C/170°C fan/gas 5. Put all the crumble ingredients in a bowl and rub together with your fingertips until you begin to get a crumbly mixture.

method.Step 4: Spoon the mincemeat equally among the pastry cases and sprinkle evenly with the crumble mixture.

method.Step 5: Bake for 15 minutes until the pastry is golden and the crumble is slightly crunchy. Leave to cool for 5 minutes in the tin, then remove to a wire rack to cool completely.

method.Step 6: Drizzle with maple syrup and a sprinkle of glitter/shimmer, if you like, or wrap in a gift box to give as a present.
